intro: Stachys harkerae, commonly known as the Harkerae hedge nettle, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are arranged in whorled clusters. Stachys harkerae is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
